Description: Black-glazed Attic pottery kantharos, handles mostly broken off; glaze partly fired red, partly flaked off; inside in bottom of bowl, rouletted circle enclosing cross of four stamped palmettes linked by thin curved lines. Underside of foot concave, domed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by McLean Museum and Art Gallery, Greenock. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Findspot marked in register. Compare Agora XII, no. 655.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1248)
